result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rheana C. Gattone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 838 Clerk HM.     Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  DE appears by Atty Watson.   Atty Watson has not had any contact with DE since SEH.   Rep of victim GNT appears today.     State is in compliance with victim rights.   State requests court enter restitution in the amt of $300.   So ordered.   State to prepare order.
DE's NOH for 6/12 RSH returned UTF.
Restitution hearing on June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
File sent to Rm 300 to schedule restitution hrg.

Minutes:  14CF1287/14CF1296.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Cases are resolved.  

14CF1287 - case is dismissed & read-in on State's motion per plea agreement w/14CF1296.  State requests restitution - defense is contesting the amount.  Rest. hrg will need to be scheduled.

14CF1296 - enhancer dismissed on count 1.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge as amended; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $200 plus costs.  30 DTP.  IN default, 8 days work crew or 16 days KCJ.  DNA previously submitted for a prior offense.
Per email from Atty Watson - cases are resolved; plea on 4/13/15 @ 9am

Minutes:  14CF1287/14CF1296.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared (35min late) w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Atty Watson requests an adjournment; deft reports to her that she suffers from seizures and is not in the right frame of mind to proceed today.  Per Court, leave on for JS for 4/13/15 @ 9am.  Attys to notify the court by 5pm on 4/9/15 if the case is resolved.  No plea bargaining after that day will be allowed.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE. Signature bond set on 12-3-14 signed in court today.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-25-15 @ 9:00am. Jury selection on 4-13-15 @ 9:00am. Atty. Watson has a jury trial previously scheduled in Br. 8 on that same date. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

After the hearing on 12/3/14, Deft was escorted by Deputy to the courthoue to appear in family court and bypassed signing her $2500 signature bond.  Clerk called Atty. Watson to make her aware that her client needs to come in to Rm 204 as soon as possible to sign this bond.  Atty Watson has made attempts at reaching the Deft.  kmk

136pm
  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 1/9/15 @ 845am.  Time limits waived by Deft.  Warrant vacated.  $2500 Signature bond Re-instated and continued as previously set.

REINSTATED
  *No Contact w/Frank L. B or his residence.
943.20(1)(a) -Theft -Movable Property (>$2500-$5000)
Voluntary Appearance/Initial -called JS canceled warrant w/Renee @ 212pm.  kmk
217pm  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Clerk: LE  No appearance by defendant. Warrant Authorized. Cash bond set at $2500.00.  kmk

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared by Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. No appearance by def. Atty. Watson believes def. may be in an in-patient treatment facility in Milwaukee. Bench warrant authorized; cash bond set at $2500. Warrant stayed until 11-19-14 @ 1:00pm.
Kristyne Watson
